intro: Vincetoxicum somaliense, commonly known as Somali milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, often pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. The plant contains toxic compounds, which can be harmful if ingested, making it important to handle with care.
